achievements: First woman to win the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction (The Age of Innocence)
Known for her insightful portrayals of upper-class American society in the late 19th and early 20th centuries
Author of acclaimed novels such as The House of Mirth, Ethan Frome, and The Custom of the Country
Founder of the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania
Developed innovative smelting processes for iron and other metals
Prominent financier and investor in various industries
